meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one quadrillionth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that a fermis is a very tiny unit of length.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use fermis to measure extremely small distances.
meanings.sent3: The ant thought the fermis was a tiny snack, not a unit of measurement!
meanings.sent4: In the world of atoms, a fermis is like a speck of dust in a vast universe.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a fermis as a minuscule dot on a never-ending line.

meanings.definition: Plural form of fermi, a unit of length equal to one quadrillionth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: There were many fermis used to measure the incredibly small distance.
meanings.sent2: The scientists calculated the distance in fermis to be accurate.
meanings.sent3: The fermis gathered together to form a tiny measuring tape!
meanings.sent4: The fermis lined up like soldiers in a minuscule army of measurement.
meanings.sent5: The fermis danced across the ruler, marking the tiny increments.

meanings.definition: The surname of a famous physicist, Enrico Fermi.
meanings.sent1: Enrico Fermi's contributions to science are well-known.
meanings.sent2: Many students study the works of Fermi in physics class.
meanings.sent3: Did you hear about the scientist named Fermi who loved to cook pasta?
meanings.sent4: In the world of physics, Fermi's name shines like a bright star.
meanings.sent5: Enrico Fermi's legacy as a physicist will never be forgotten.
